div.div:
Nigel - July 1, 2012 - HTC Thunderbolt with version 2.1.5.2
Used to be amazing, but now..
Ever since the latest updates tailored to ICS, Ilauncher has lost it's stability on my Gingerbread device. Exiting apps result in motion-blured freeze-ups where the dock and bottom row of icons disappear. Also, the iOS-like zooming effect of the icons is now gone. So for now, despite it's inability to customize icons - unlike iLauncher - I'm using Espier Launcher. I keep checking, either for an OTA update to ICS, or for iLauncher's return to it's former glory.

Georgij - June 30, 2012 - Version 2.1.5.2
Finally a decent launcher
even though its has small flaws like no live wallpaper yet and small bugs the developer(s) are fixing them and updating this app frequently. I would pay 10 euro for this app BUT PAID 1 DOLLAR. Thanks a lot FOR CREATING ILAUNCHER Can you possibly fix customization for dock? Like hide it or make it transparent or change it? And is it possible to make a enable/disable search screen? possible to fix ilauncher Icon change? or even settings by double tapping or holding anywhere at the screen? possible to hide any kind of app? Overall possible to make it more dynamic and configurable please? I ll buy it again even if u higher the price.

douganderson - July 1, 2012 - Motorola Photon 4G with version 2.1.5.2
Photon
Last update messed everything up again. Screen blurs and freezes and contact shortcut FC.

Rikos - June 28, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Ace with version 2.1.5.1
You are awesome
You fixed the bugs in 3 days after the last update ! Finally someone who actually fixes the app ! Keep this up

Romano - July 2, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 2.1.5.1
samsung s 4g better than espier
For the guy who asked why he can't get ipad theme, it's because they are basically the same program but just modified. They aren't themes, so you can't install it twice.

Alexander - July 4, 2012 - Samsung Exhibit 2 4G with version 2.1.5.1
It needs a notification number for the apps
This is the best app to me but can you make like the little numbers come along with it like for twitter,app store,facebook,tumblr,instagram and etc. PLEASE

Please
Still doesn't have the edit icon option. Please bring that back

Jameson - June 28, 2012 - Version 2.1.5.1
Good fix
Developer had a really good response time in fixing the bad glitches in the previous release. I would still like to see hidden apps, since there are so many unwanted ones on my screen and the Spotlight search doesn't take me directly to what I want. If I search for a contact and click it, I am brought to my general contacts screen, not the contact. If this continues to improve it will be the best iPhone emulator launcher for Android hands down.

tmb - May 26, 2012 - Version 2.1.3.4
nice start, but buggy
A simpler, single-level launcher is a nice idea, and this is a good start. Unfortunately, it is rather buggy. For example, when creating folders, the folders and the apps they contain just disappear completely. The launcher also has copied some of the worst features of the iPhone launcher, such as the weird dance when trying to drop an icon into a folder. Trying to change between screens while moving icons often ends up trying to uninstall an app. And while I like this style of launcher in general, I wonder whether it really needs to stick so slavishly to the original. For example, the ability to add widgets to the home screens or to rearrange screens via zoom out and dragging wouldn't kill the simplicity of the launcher but make it a lot more usable. In addition, I'd prefer if it used the original Android icons, or at least gave me a choice.

Ugo Francesco - May 16, 2012 - Version 2.1.3.4
Very good app
There's one thing that could be added: multi- tasking function like in Espier Launcher
